alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 10:28AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK OF WILDFIRE SPREAD THIS AFTERNOON... A combination of low relative humidity, steady northwesterly winds and dry fine fuels will lead to an elevated risk for fire spread into this evening across much of eastern Pennsylvania. Minimum relative humidity values will range from 20 to 30 percent. Additionally, northwesterly winds will accompany these dry conditions, sustained 10-15 mph with gusts around 20 mph possible through this afternoon. Winds will relax quickly this evening and RH will rise as temperatures cool. Residents are urged to exercise caution handling any potential ignition source, including machinery, cigarettes, and matches. Be sure to properly discard all smoking materials. Any dry grasses, dead leaves and other tree litter that ignite will have the potential to spread fire quickly. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
